column4: My installation keeps freezing on me.  It boots, and runs for varying times and then just freezes.  Can someone tell me how to run a harddisk check?
check your ram too, memory
HOw would I check it?  Take all RAM out, then put one back, boot and leave it to run, then add one and leave it running etc.?
there is the memory check option on the grub menu, something that can be done at startup, also your machine must have it in the bios menu
Thank you.
must/may/hope
It is an Lubuntu machine... no Grub menu appears.  It just goes straight into boot.
how about in the bios?
No :(
i wont tell you how to configure grub, not comfortable doing it, but grub can be configured to allow you the time you need to use the 'check mem' option

Nevermind Grub hehehe  The machine does not even boot anymore.  It starts up, BIOS shows devices etc and then where it usually would say "Starting Windows" or whatever on a Windows machine it just reboots, over and over and over.
lets assume google-chat does, what would you do?
Um, try to get Skyp working because all my contacts use it :)
do you have vlc installed?
Nope.
Should I?
there must be a settings screen for skype, what options do you have for 'camera'?
None.  Skype dos not detct the camera, but lsusb shows that it is there.
no setup area for the camera?
in skype?
No camera in Skype
So Skype will not work :(
heres a thought, install pidgin along with the skype plugin, install skype, use pidgin to control skype, pidgin does allow for setup of vid/voice
